questiontext.text: Is the triangle [startlatexinline ABC endlatexinline] with lengths as follows, right-angled? If so, determine its right angle.  [startlatexinline AB=5 cm endlatexinline]  [startlatexinline  BC=3 cm endlatexinline]  [startlatexinline CA=4 cm endlatexinline]

input1.label: questionQCMlabel
input1.value: {1:MCS:Not right-angled~Right-angled in A~Right-angled in B~%100%Right-angled in C}

generalfeedback.text: The candidate for the hypotenuse is the longuest side of the triangle, hence, in our case, the side [startlatexinline AB endlatexinline]. By the converse of Pythagoras's theorem, if the triangle [startlatexinline ABC endlatexinline] were right-angled, it would satisfy:  [startlatex BC^2+CA^2=AB^2. endlatex]  Let us calculate:  [startlatex BC^2+CA^2=3^2+4^2=9+16=25, endlatex]  and  [startlatex AB^2=5^2=25. endlatex] Given that [startlatex BC^2+CA^2=AB^2 endlatex], the triangle [startlatexinline ABC endlatexinline] is right-angled in [startlatexinline C endlatexinline].

generalfeedback.text: The candidate for the hypotenuse is the longuest side of the triangle, hence, in our case, the side [startlatexinline BC endlatexinline]. By the converse of Pythagoras's theorem, if the triangle [startlatexinline ABC endlatexinline] were right-angled, it would satisfy:  [startlatex CA^2+AB^2=BC^2. endlatex]  Let us calculate:  [startlatex CA^2+AB^2=39^2+6^2=1521+36=1557, endlatex]  and  [startlatex BC^2=43^2=1849. endlatex] Given that [startlatex CA^2+AB^2 \neq BC^2 endlatex], the triangle [startlatexinline ABC endlatexinline] is not right-angled.

generalfeedback.text: The candidate for the hypotenuse is the longuest side of the triangle, hence, in our case, the side [startlatexinline CA endlatexinline]. By the converse of Pythagoras's theorem, if the triangle [startlatexinline ABC endlatexinline] were right-angled, it would satisfy:  [startlatex AB^2+BC^2=CA^2. endlatex]  Let us calculate:  [startlatex AB^2+BC^2=78^2+20^2=6084+400=6484, endlatex]  and  [startlatex CA^2=84^2=7056. endlatex] Given that [startlatex AB^2+BC^2 \neq CA^2 endlatex], the triangle [startlatexinline ABC endlatexinline] is not right-angled.
